snippet: Years after the death of John Howard Yoder, many Mennonites still grapple with the conflict between his beliefs and his behavior toward women.
abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column holds that John Howard Yoder, Mennonite Christian and America’s most influential pacifist theologian, failed egregiously in common-sense expectation that religious professionals should try to behave as they counsel others to; Mennonites today still grapple with conflict between Yoder's beliefs and revelations made before his death that he groped many women or pressured them to have physical contact.
lead_paragraph: Years after the death of John Howard Yoder, many Mennonites still grapple with the conflict between his beliefs and his behavior toward women.

headline.print_headline: A Theologian’s Influence, And Stained Past, Live On
